cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida

motion.direction: N (expected to turn NNE then NE)

cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northeast, then accelerating northeast toward Florida’s northwest Gulf Coast with a diagonal track across the peninsula and out into the western Atlantic toward the GA/SC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend / Apalachee Bay area of northwest Florida (near Apalachicola–Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL from Aripeka to Indian Pass; later GA and Carolina coasts after exiting Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; prevailing winds expected to remain below gale force at PortMiami
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring brief heavy showers, but widespread totals around Miami are expected to remain below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk mainly across central–north Florida; not expected in the Miami area
